Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. It is a **bug**. ### Overview of the problem I'm using Bulma **version** 0.8.0 ### Description The `is-full-tablet` column class is not being respected when there is a top level size, such as `is-one-third` or `is-two-fifths`. ### Steps to Reproduce This is basic html that outlines the issue: ``` Hello Bulma!
Column 1
Column 2
``` ### Expected behavior Column 1 should fill the whole window once the window is < 1024px wide and Column 2 should disappear. ### Actual behavior Column 1 fills the whole window once the window is < 769px wide and Column 2 disappears when the window is < 1024px wide. ### Notes I am able to get my desired behaviour by setting Column 1's class to `"column is-full-mobile is-full-tablet is-one-third-desktop is-one-third-widescreen is-one-third-fullhd"`

Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

I have a basic web site that uses the traditional [navbar-burger](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#navbar-burger) with JavaScript toggle.

When using *Samsung Internet Browser* with *Night Mode* enabled (aka *Dark Mode*), the burger is practically hidden -- it is basically black on black, so the button works if you know it is there, but it isn't obvious that it is there.

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**

### Description

<!-- Description of the bug, enhancement, or question -->

Issues.Title: Duplicate sizes causes missing .is-size-* and .title.is-* declarations
Issues.Body:
- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
- I'm using Bulma's **master branch**
- I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

Due to the way `@each` and `index()` are used in the size helpers, Bulma will only generate CSS for the first of any duplicate sizes definitions. A duplicate size definition would look like this:

```sass
$size-1: 100px
$size-2: 100px
@import "bulma"
```

This happens because `index()` always grabs the index of the _first_ matching value. Because this is a nuance specific to `index()`, this bug only affects 3 places in the Bulma codebase:

1. https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/0c43b9e4663ae040d47d2a373ded5ba914b7d10f/sass/base/helpers.sass#L25-L28
1. https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/0c43b9e4663ae040d47d2a373ded5ba914b7d10f/sass/elements/title.sass#L49-L52
1. https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/0c43b9e4663ae040d47d2a373ded5ba914b7d10f/sass/elements/title.sass#L67-L70
### Steps to Reproduce

I setup an example repository with the compiled CSS where you can see the current behavior:

- Code: https://github.com/hkgumbs/bulma-size-bug-demo
- Demo: https://hkgumbs.github.io/bulma-size-bug-demo/
- TL;DR
  1. Set variables `size-1` and `size-2` to the same value (i.e. `100px`)
  1. Compile Bulma via the normal means
  1. Compiled CSS **does not** include declarations for `is-size-2`/`is-2`

### Expected behavior

Bulma would produce declarations for `is-size-1`/`is-1` _and_ `is-size-2`/`is-2`. All of these declarations would be set to the same value (`100px` in this case).

### Actual behavior

Bulma produces 2 declarations for `is-size-1`/`is-1` and 0 for `is-size-2`/`is-2`: https://github.com/hkgumbs/bulma-size-bug-demo/blob/master/output.css#L378-L382
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Duplicate sizes causes missing .is-size-* and .title.is-* declarations" (#2802)

Issues.Title: Form select not inheriting font size
Issues.Body:
This is about the select element inside a form component. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** My **browser** is: firefox. ### Description When doing a direct copy and paste of the form select example from the docs, it looks like the select component is not inheriting the font size from is-large. Example: ```
``` The div element with the class "select is-large" should be placing the large font size onto the select element, however after inspecting the select element: .select select, ... { font-size: 1rem; } Something is declaring a font-size of 1rem onto the select component. This isn't from any custom sass declaration. After going through the imports, it looks like the issue is caused by this cascading import statements: @import "../../node_modules/bulma/sass/form/_all.sass"; @import "../../node_modules/bulma/sass/utilities/_all.sass"; The utilities import is causing the select component to: 1. inherit a font size of 1 rem, and not inheriting from is-large, or any modifiers. 2. hiding the dropdown arrow and the border around the select 3. enabling the dropdown arrow and the border only when hovered ### Steps to Reproduce 1. import the form sass all file from node modules. 2. import the utilities sass all file from node modules, and import it directly AFTER the form import. 3. copy & paste the select component example from the bulma docs. ### Expected behavior I expect the select component to inherit the font size from any is-typography modifier, and to show the border and dropdown arrow. ### Actual behavior The select component is not inheriting the font size, but instead being declared a font size of 1 rem. the border and dropdown arrows are also hidden, and only visible on hover.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form select not inheriting font size" (#2796)

Issues.Body:

Feature Request

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**

> I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**?

### Description

> Description of the bug, enhancement, or question

I've been noticing more and more that a lot of websites are adding "placeholders" that look like this: https://semantic-ui.com/elements/placeholder.html. It makes the website feel a lot more fluid especially with React/Vue/etc.

It seems to be possible purely with CSS as seen with the semantic-ui api. I'm not sure what the distinction is between adding it to the framework and making an extension but I believe that this may be relatively complex as each UI element may require different heights and widths (Cards vs Message vs Modals, etc)
